chapter_title: 14. We shall be unable to turn natural advantage to
claims: We shall be unable to turn natural advantage to account unless we make use of local guides.
rules: In war, practice dissimulation, and you will succeed.
Whether to concentrate or to divide your troops, must be decided by circumstances.
Let your rapidity be that of the wind, your compactness that of the forest.
In raiding and plundering be like fire, immovability like a mountain.
Let your plans be dark and impenetrable as night, and when you move, fall like a thunderbolt.
When you plunder a countryside, let the spoil be divided amongst your men; when you capture new territory, cut it up into allotments for the benefit of the soldier.
